text: Stroud is a market town and civil parish in the centre of Gloucestershire, England. It is 16 kilometres south of Gloucester, 24 kilometres south- southwest of Cheltenham, 21 kilometres west-northwest of Cirencester and 42 kilometres northeast of Bristol. It is known for its steep streets and caf√© culture. ==History== Stroud Parish was originally part of Bisely, until the church was assigned parochial rights by the rectors of Bisely in 1304. It was heavily involved in the Industrial Revolution as a cloth town. ==References== Category:Market towns in England Category:Civil parishes in Gloucestershire
title: Stroud
